errors.pattern: not a valid OpenAPI|validation error|Failed to read
errors.cause: Input spec file has syntax or structural errors

solutions.code: openapi-generator validate -i openapi.yaml

# https://editor.swagger.io/
# Paste spec and see errors highlighted

# Check:
# - Valid YAML/JSON syntax
# - Required fields: openapi, info, paths
# - Valid $ref pointers

errors.pattern: Unknown generator|Generator .* not found|no generator named
errors.cause: Generator name misspelled or not available

solutions.code: openapi-generator list

# Common generators:
# typescript-axios, typescript-fetch
# python, python-flask
# go, go-server
# java, spring, kotlin

openapi-generator version
# Some generators added in newer versions

errors.pattern: output directory|Cannot write|Permission denied|directory not found
errors.cause: Output path doesn't exist or not writable

solutions.code:
mkdir -p ./generated
openapi-generator generate -i spec.yaml -g typescript-axios -o ./generated

chmod 755 ./generated
# Or run with appropriate user
openapi-generator generate -i spec.yaml -g python -o /full/path/to/output

errors.cause: Custom template has errors or missing

solutions.code:
# Mustache templates use:
# {{variableName}} - variable
# {{#items}}...{{/items}} - iteration
# {{^items}}...{{/items}} - inverted (if empty)

# Generate without -t to use defaults:
openapi-generator generate -i spec.yaml -g typescript-axios -o ./out
openapi-generator author template -g typescript-axios -o ./templates

errors.cause: $ref points to non-existent schema or file

solutions.code:
# Internal ref:
$ref: '#/components/schemas/User'

# External ref:
$ref: './schemas/user.yaml#/User'

npx @apidevtools/swagger-cli bundle spec.yaml -o bundled.yaml
openapi-generator generate -i bundled.yaml -g python -o ./out

components:
  schemas:
    User:  # This must exist if referenced
      type: object

errors.message: OpenAPI feature not supported by generator

solutions.code:
openapi-generator config-help -g typescript-axios
# See supported features

# Avoid:
# - anyOf/oneOf (use simpler structures)
# - Circular references
# - Very deep nesting

# Try similar generator with better support:
# typescript-axios vs typescript-fetch
# python vs python-flask

errors.message: Generated name conflicts or is reserved
errors.cause: Schema/operation name clashes with language keywords

solutions.code:
openapi-generator generate -i spec.yaml -g python \
    --model-name-prefix Api

openapi-generator generate -i spec.yaml -g java \
    --reserved-words-mappings class=clazz

# Use x-model-name extension:
User:
  x-model-name: UserModel
  type: object

errors.message: Cannot map OpenAPI type to target language
errors.cause: Type doesn't have mapping in generator

solutions.code:
openapi-generator generate -i spec.yaml -g typescript \
    --type-mappings DateTime=string

openapi-generator generate -i spec.yaml -g java \
    --import-mappings DateTime=java.time.OffsetDateTime

# Use standard formats:
# string: date, date-time, uuid, email
# integer: int32, int64
# number: float, double
python -m json.tool config.json  # Validates JSON

openapi-generator config-help -g typescript-axios
# Shows valid config options

openapi-generator generate -i spec.yaml -g python \
    --additional-properties=packageName=myapi,packageVersion=1.0.0

errors.cause: Schema A references B which references A

solutions.code:
# Instead of direct reference:
User:
  properties:
    friend:
      $ref: '#/components/schemas/User'  # Circular

# Use nullable or optional:
    friend:
      allOf:
        - $ref: '#/components/schemas/UserBase'
      nullable: true

openapi-generator generate -i spec.yaml -g python \
    --additional-properties=recursionLimit=5

# Split into base and extended schemas
# Use IDs instead of nested objects

errors.message: Java runtime or build tool error

solutions.code:
# macOS:
brew install openjdk@11

# Ubuntu:
sudo apt install openjdk-11-jdk

export JAVA_HOME=/usr/lib/jvm/java-11-openjdk
export PATH=$JAVA_HOME/bin:$PATH

docker run --rm -v ${PWD}:/local \
    openapitools/openapi-generator-cli generate \
    -i /local/spec.yaml -g python -o /local/out
